snippet: James R. Clapper Jr., the director of national intelligence, also said that President Bashar al-Assad of Syria had benefited from a deal to abandon his chemical weapons arsenal.
abstract: National Intelligence Dir James R Clapper Jr says that Syrian Pres Bashar al-Assad's hold on power has strengthened over past year and that he has benefited from deal to abandon his chemical weapons arsenal; concern has been mounting in both Congress and the Obama administration that policy toward Syria is faltering on several fronts.

byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and MARK MAZZETTI
byline.contributor: Eric Schmitt contributed reporting from Washington, and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: James R. Clapper Jr., the director of national intelligence, also said that President Bashar al-Assad of Syria had benefited from a deal to abandon his chemical weapons arsenal.

headline.main: U.S. Spy Chief Says Assad Has Strengthened His Hold on Power
headline.print_headline: U.S. Spy Chief Says Assad Has Strengthened His Hold on Power

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject
